Reviews.Title: “Fabulous gem of a hotel in wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: MColijn
Reviews.Content: Hotel Villa Beatrice is like going to stay at your aunt's beautiful holiday home. Welcomed like nowhere else, you feel at home immediately. The garden, with singing birds and nice terrace are perfect for relaxing after a long day. Very comfortable, clean, and easy to get to. By being away from the city center by boat and bus on the lido, you feel the calm settling as you arrive. Beatrice goes out of her way to make you feel at home, and help you along. She booked us an early morning boat-taxi for us that arrived 100 meters from the Villa. I look forward to returning for a family vacation and staying with them again.

Reviews.Title: “A great way to see Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Michele W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just enjoyed a wonderful break in Venice which was largely due to the relaxing and comfortable stay we had at Villa Beatrice. The warm welcome from this family run hotel and our excellent room meant that we looked forward to returning each evening after day trips to Venice and the Islands. The generous breakfast overlooking the charming garden set us up for the adventures of each day. We took advantage of the hotel bicycles and enjoyed a day of cycling together along the coastal path on the Lido itself. In a very short time we felt like locals helped by the daily bus trip to and from the ferry. We would warmly recommend Hotel Villa Beatrice for a break in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel would have been great in its hey day.”
Reviews.Author: markledwidge
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights, just a shame they have stopped the ferry service for foot passengers to Venice, which would have been a five minute walk away from the hotel.Hotel ok the lady that run the hotel was very nice and helpful, I think it was her husband who seemed drunk a lot of the time but he to was very pleasant and helpful. prob wouldn't stay here again as it is just to far away from the main ferry terminal ( 25mins by bus) then about 15 mins by ferry to Venice. Such a shame the ferry has stopped because Alberoni would be a buzzy place, loved to have visited when the old ferry was running my review would have been a lot better. Hotel tucked away and very quaint. Garden could do with a bit of mow. Bedrooms quite basic but adequate for short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and hospitable”
Reviews.Author: Tord B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Villa Beatrice for one week in October, and we were very satisfied with our stay there. The hotel was easily found close to the bus stop. We had a good room with a balcony overlooking the roomy enclosed garden. In the morning we enjoyed a nice comprehensive breakfast. Villa Beatrice has a quiet atmosphere, and the hosts are serviceminded and friendly. We liked going by vaporetto through a breathtaking seascape to the city, or just walking on the beach, as it was now too cold for bathing.We would like to come back to Villa Beatrice.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to rest at a very good value price”
Reviews.Author: skandal00
Reviews.Content: Hotel Villa Beatrice, even quite far from the center of Venice, it is a perfect place to rest and a really cozy hotel. Very good value, it is very nice place to discover Lido Island. To take the ferry boat every morning to go to San Marco' square was a pleasure (around 20 min) because you can admire the city from there. You can't miss to take the Alilaguna nÂº1 from Lido to Train Station: the best way to see all il Canal Grande! Good communication to the airport too (direct Alilaguna to Marco Polo airport)

Reviews.Title: “Villa Beatrice is wawWwonderful”
Reviews.Author: benbeirens
Reviews.Content: Villa Beatrice is simply my number 1 spot to stay whenever I wanna visit Venice..... and I go A LOTTTT !!! It is located 50m from the lagune with the marvellous view on Venice, and the beach and open sea are just 200m on the other side. It is located in the most zone which is called Alberoni. Also the public transport to get & go away from there is excellent. Beatrice is always kind & helpful and offers nice suggestions. It always feels like coming home whenever I arrive back in wawWwonderful Villa Beatrice !

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Both Worlds”
Reviews.Author: dampsquib
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Hotel Villa Beatrice and we enjoyed it immensely. The villa feels more like a private home than an hotel. Rooms are individually furnished and decorated, while art works throughout the hotel add to its charm. The welcoming proprietor lives in a flat above the hotel and is on hand for assistance, if required. We found service to be discreet and efficient. Our room was a good size with a spare single bed, wardrobe, desk and chairs. The room was fully air-conditioned and also had a ceiling fan, opening windows and adjustable shutters, so it was comfortable in all climatic conditions. The spacious private bathroom was well-equipped and had its own opening window. We initially chose the hotel for its location on the Lido as we were travelling by car and preferred to park the car at the hotel rather than in a remote car park. However, we soon found the location's chief benefit to be the ability to enjoy a beach holiday and a city break simultaneously. There are both a managed beach (deck chairs, restaurant etc) and undeveloped beaches within easy walking distance of the hotel and, even closer, a pizzaria and a direct (privately operated) ferry to Zattare in Venice. At the hotel, we enjoyed continental bufffet breakfast in the private, enclosed, garden, which was also perfect for relaxing and sun-bathing. We took advantage of the hotel's bicycles to visit other parts of the Lido and purchased three-day passes, giving unlimited use of Venice's public transport, for trips further afield. These included travel on buses from the hotel to the Lido's main boat station and waterborne transport to all parts of Venice. Night services on both the boats and the buses enabled us to enjoy Venice's night life before returning to the tranquillity of our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Villa Beatrice is the best value in all of Venice, complete with romance and practicality and a caring staff”
Reviews.Author: SShiflet
Reviews.Content: We arrived weary, early in the day. There was confusion beyond the hotel's control over our reservation dates, but the hotel operators did not let the issues get in the way of welcoming us and giving us great service. They adjusted their schedule to accomodate us, and from the moment we arrived, we felt welcomed and comfortable. The rooms are comfortable and clearly maintained by people who care. Breakfast was consistently fresh, delicious, and shared with a smile. Don't miss the home-made jams and jellies--the fruit comes right out of the courtyard. And that courtyard--terrific place to gather for a drink, to take a nap, or to play with the ancient little Tutle, Mpouffi, who summers on the Lido with Beatrice and company. We enjoyed everything about our stay there--from great sheets, towels, provisions to free bicycles and guidance to relax around the Lido. The pictures on the web page for the hotel don't come close to doing this place justice. It is a quite oasis amid a lovely section of the Lido...it is at once remote and amid all the ammentities and activities you need--beach is just a half km away and is open to the public--rare in Lido. The hotel is pleasantly appointed with family heirlooms, family art (quite good, by the way), and modern conveniences. All the graciousness of Italy is alive at Villa Beatrice. Places like this are few and far between. We were delighted to land in this enchanted spot and plan to return often....all of the value a family needs with all of the charm of the layers of Venice and the Lido.

Reviews.Title: “Great Villa to Stay if you want to enjoy Alberoni and Lido”
Reviews.Author: spartako
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Italy/Venice and we felt very happy that we selected this hotel. The rate we got was very good compared to other villa in Lido/Venice and the service was very very good. The breakfast in the morning is a treat, plus if you like cats, there is a guy called Spartako, he is playful and a joy to play to start your morning. It is a distance from Lido (Elisbetta - main junction in Lido), but worth it. The transportation was so convenient, it really did not bother us. We loved taking the bus. The restaurant/golf course and the friendly people of Alberoni, just want to say we had a blast staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Villa Beatrice - marvellous place!”
Reviews.Author: Bartik
Reviews.Content: We second time staying at this hotel. Villa Beatrice can it therefore recommend as a beautiful place. Relaxed and quiet atmosphere. We'll certainly stay at Villa Beatrice again, because it is a marvellous place!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Week”
Reviews.Author: Dick43
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Villa Beatrice was the perfect place for us, because we wanted both a good public beach nearby and proximity to Venice. The travel to and from Venice by bus and vaporetto was easy and pleasant, even welcome after the bustle of the city. And it was regular and always on time. The hotel is clean, bright, quiet, and Signora Beatrice is the ideal hostess in all ways. We plan to go back, and recommend it highly to others.

Reviews.Title: “perfect esthetics”
Reviews.Author: mtv55
Reviews.Content: it's rare to find an Italian hotel with a similar sense of esthetics - the interior is decorated with original paintings mainly by Alvise Grandese, a contemporary Venetian painter of international fame, the rooms are decorated partly with an impressive collection of molluscs, the garden with its very old turtle and plenty of trees invites for a charming rest in an undisturbed atmosphere. I know Hotel Villa Beatrice from many stays since 1984 and can it therefore recommend as a good place for Venetian mid term tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and peaceful location on the Lido, comfortable room and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: UkJetsetter29
Reviews.Content: Once on the Lido make sure you catch a bus that goes to Alberoni and don't get off too soon! There is a bus stop just round the corner from the hotel so you don't have far to walk. It is a quiet hotel with only a few bedrooms but they are well equipped and spotlessly clean and comfortable. Breakfasts are good with plenty of variety and you can eat as much as you want. No restrictions on what time you have to be back to the hotel at the end of the day, you have your own gate key and pick up the door key from reception yourself. It is a friendly hotel but no-one interferes with what you are doing. A good place to stay away from the hustle and bustle of Venice but near enough to access it each day. It was well worth the money we paid and would defintely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JulieEHull
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. The husband and wife team were both kind and always helpful, and nothing was too much trouble for them. My room was good; it was also always clean and towels and sheets were changed regularly. In addition, the terrace and gardens are beautiful and compliment the hotel well. All in all, staying here was an extremely pleasurable experience and intend to go again and again There is also a nearby beach, which is a 10 minute stroll away or 5 minutes on one of the free bikes the hotel let you use. The local people of Alberoni are very friendly and was made to feel welcome in the nearby bars despite my lack of Italian. It is also easy to get to Venice, which I did at least once a day, as the bus and vaperotto service are excellent. Staying at Hotel Villa Beatrice means you get the best of both worlds - the beach and Venice in one holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've ever stayed in! Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: normanDublin
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and i stayed 2 nights in this hotel, would have loved to stay longer. Had a wonderful time. Our room was spacious and airy, tastefully decorated in white and creams. Room included a fully stocked mini bar, a large fan over our bed and air conditioning! The bar at the hotel was great and the garden with wild plums and apples made our stay all the better. Staff were really helpful and easy going. We hope to return some day!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: AnniDYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Villa Beatrice as it was getting dark (around 7pm - end March) To get there at the time of year we went - involved getting a waterbus from the airport, about 40 mins then public transport, around 20 mins - and more than full to capacity, which was quite difficult with luggage, to the Villa, which was more or less at the other end of the island. By the time we reached the Villa we were both very tired. We had a short walk around the area but could not locate anywhere to get a meal or even a shop that was open. We returned to our room, I was really glad that I had brought a travel kettle, after reading a review. The room was basic, there was a tv (only English channels were CNN and MTV) but that didn't matter. There was a shower room and pleanty of wardrobe space. I was pleased that we had been given a first floor room with a balcony which overlooked the very pleasant garden. Next morning we met Beatrice who is a very nice lady. Breakfast consisted of toast, rolls, buttter, cheese and jams. Also coffee and juice. There were only a couple of other guests there that weekend so it was very quiet. As it is quite a trek to get to the centre of Venice, once again having to use the bus, then the water bus (15 mins to St Marks Square from the Lido jetty), when you have gone out for the day, you really have to stay out. So for people who like to return to their hotel during the day they would find it not very suitable. However, if you like to be in amongst the local people then you would enjoy staying here as I don't think there are many tourists who find their way to this area and I only saw one other small hotel. We did actually like travelling on the bus and waterbus everyday. We met quite a few 'characters' and the locals were mostly very friendly. Beatrice's husband has done some 'interesting' artwork which is displayed around the hotel. It certainly gave us something to talk about over breakfast. All in all, the villa is basic, quiet and I am sure in a lovely area. We would loved to have had more time to explore the Lido but as it was quite a chilly and rainy week-end we did not get to see much of the area at all, going across to the centre and Murano instead. Be aware that there is a little building work going on quite close to the Villa but you cannot see or hear anything. Also, if you are looking for a small supermarket the only one we found on the Lido is straight ahead, along the main street, around 200-250 metres from the Jetty. There are also lots of smaller shops around this area. Would I return? yes, but probably around May/June when the weather would be warmer and the nights longer.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and friendly”
Reviews.Author: rogerm90
Reviews.Content: I'd wanted to stay somewhere near Venice to celebrate my wife's 60th birthday, as she'd always wanted to go there. My daughter found the hotel on the web for me, and we weren't disappointed with our choice! We were allocated a ground floor room, which was well appointed and had a very comfortable bed. Breakfast was excellent, with a good choice of continental dishes, and the staff were very friendly. The garden attached to the hotel is secluded with chairs and reclining seats, and boasts a number of trees providing shade on a hot summer's day. It's also very quiet, as noise from the main street is largely absorbed by the surrounding buildings. The fact that Alberoni, where the hotel is situated, is about half an hour by bus to Lido, where one can catch the waterbus to Venice, just added to the enjoyment, as the service was frequent. We'll certainly stay at Villa Beatrice again, should we visit Venice again. Roger Manser (UK)

Reviews.Title: “Transportation reality at Villa Beatrice”
Reviews.Author: Fan_of_Italy_2007
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is good and the owners are fluent in English and provide reasonably good service. Our problem is that the information on the website (Venerra and others) misrepresented the time and difficulties in transporting to this site back and forth from Venice. We spent a minimum of 1.5 hours commuting each way and up to 2 hours one way. The buses do not run on time as the website states, moreover none of the drivers would speak to anyone or give any help. The Alberoni bus actually consists of 2 different routes, one of which makes a figure 8 loop and never goes near the hotel. The bus stop and the drivers never seem to be able to tell you which one is which. We were also forced to get off the bus part way home late at night because the driver did not feel like finishing the route. The bus to the vaporetti stop never took less than 30 minutes on our watches, unlike the web instructions. The hotel is not marked from the road so can be tricky to find while lugging around bags. Taking the water taxi is not a viable option unless you have an extra 70$ for a one way trip. Taxis also seemed over price on the island, wanting 20$ for the ride from the Lido dock to this hotel. I think this hotel is very suitable for staying on Lido and enjoying the bike rides but for a few days touring of Venice, the transport is a hassle, tiring and overcrowded.

Reviews.Title: “Beware which room you get”
Reviews.Author: tsingiwoman
Reviews.Content: This is a very friendly and clean hotel in the not so much sleepy as comatose village of Alberoni at the southern end of the Venice Lido. The hotel is easily reached by the local bus service which runs every 10 minutes during the day, a little less frequently at night, to the main centre of the Lido. Also, during the summer months, there's a ferry service running from Alberoni's quay to Zattere in Venice proper. The beach is less than 10 minutes walk away, there's both a public beach infront of the sand dunes and a managed beach with umbrellas and sun-loungers for hire. Although I really liked the hotel, I didn't like the location of my room. Room 1 was right next to the front door, reception and the bar come breakfast room. Although no one staying at the Villa Beatrice could possibly be called roudy, every clatter of breakfast plates, phone ringing in reception or click of the front door was audible from my bed. Also, the path leading around to the back of the hotel was right next to my windows, so I was overlooked both on my bed and on my loo seat. For this reason, I kept the shutters and curtains pulled throughout my stay. I would stay at the Villa Beatrice again, but only if I was guaranteed a room that wasn't on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “How hard can it be to manage a 10 room guest house?”
Reviews.Author: mickko
Reviews.Content: This place is nice, and clean with lovely gardens, but had some problems. Stayed here for 5 nights at the end of september. The first problem is that it is at the other end of Lido island and takes at least 15 mins by bus to get there from the ferry terminal. More importatly though, on booking directly with the owners, I specifically asked for a 2nd floor room with a terrace which they confirmed was available and we agreed on the price. However, after the gruelling journey to get there, on arrival we were told that there was none available and also that there was no reduction on the price which we were not happy about at all. We felt that this was done deliberately as she must have known this beforehand and it was just to make up numbers. After all, when you get there, it's so secluded that you really have no choice but to stay. How hard can it be to manage a 10 room guest house! She tried to avoid us for the rest of our stay, was very insincere whenever we spoke to her, and we could sense her guilt. It was a very unfair thing to do as we were looking forward to sitting out and reading in the sunshine, and saving ourselves some money by not having to spend every day going to the city. It's a great option to have if you want to just stay there and chill out. Without a terrace, you simply had to leave your room after breakfast. There was nothing else to do, nor is there anything much to do in the area. Beach is about 10 mins walk though. Towels were also not changed on more than one occasion, and the only english speaking channel is CNN. The bed were extremely comfortable though, and we liked the decor. It was very "riviera" style. Breakfast was nice and plentiful. The lady who serves breakfast is so rude that it's nearly comical. She seemed to make a point about only talking in Italian to us despite the fact that it was clear we had no idea what she was saying. She only gave us the option for a normal coffee, and we noticed that it said that you could have cappucino on our confirmation email. If you want to annoy her, ask her to make a cappucino at about 5 mins to 10. The highlight of our stay really, if a little childish. Overall, this place is ok. I'd imagine if we had gotten what we paid for it would have been more enjoyable. We just felt ripped off. Moved to a much nicer place at the other end of Lido for the remainder of our stay. Check my other review for a alternative place really worthwhile, at the same price, and with alot more thrown in............

Reviews.Title: “Just okay...”
Reviews.Author: ChTruffles
Reviews.Content: Good & bad with this one. Iâ€™ll start with the good. The bed was very comfortable, and although I was booked in a single, it was a double bed. Good facilities; washroom was clean, and not too small. Water was hot â€“ be prepared though and bring your flip flops for the shower as there really isnâ€™t a shower stall, just a curtain and the whole bathroom is your showerâ€¦The garden view from the bar is exactly as described on the website and quite lovely. Youâ€™re given keys to the gate upon arrival so you can come and go as you please. Beatrice seemed very friendly, though her husband was a little standoffish â€“ I didnâ€™t spend much time there beyond sleeping and having breakfast though, so take that as you will. Breakfast consisted of coffee, juice, sliced meat, cereal, yogurt, rolls, fruit salad (looked canned), cheese. The bad â€“ itâ€™s a lot further than implied on the website. Be prepared for not only the boat trip to Lido (53 mins b/w Ferrovia & Lido on line 1), but make sure you factor in the bus ride to the hotel â€“ itâ€™s somewhere between 15-25 minutes, depending on the traffic and the time of day. Itâ€™s literally the last stop on line A or B toward Alberoni. The three nights that I was there, the towels werenâ€™t changed (is that standard for a b&b?). I wasnâ€™t given a map of Venice either, which was pretty standard everywhere else that I stayed on my journey. Would also recommend that you request a room with a balcony - the â€œterraceâ€� room(s) are on the ground floor, and shuttered so you donâ€™t get very much light, and absolutely no view, unless you count the 12 inch space between the window ledge and the bottom of the shutter. Room was also a little cold (early May). Overall, I would recommend it â€“ it was clean, it was quiet, and the prices were reasonable. Youâ€™ll need a vaporetto pass though, for the appropriate number of days â€“ it was invaluable!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Villa Beatrice
HotelInfo.Address: Via dei Villini 4 | Venice Lido - Alberoni, 30126 Venice, Italy
